com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface recordSale

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface recordSale

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document recordSale(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      recordSale API is used to record a new sales transaction of a particular order.

    • Method Detail

      • recordSale

        org.w3c.dom.Document recordSale(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException
        recordSale API is used to record a new sales transaction of a particular order.

        The recording of new sales transaction will ensure the following:

        • If the order is in Draft state, this will confirm the order.
        • Collections made on the POS will be recorded against the order. This signifies that the customer has made payments for the order and the order has been confirmed.
        • If a previous sale against this order has been post-voided, this API will set the SaleVoided flag as 'N'.
        • Remove the AutoCancelDate on the order.


        recordSale API uses the following transactions.

        • DRAFT_ORDER_CONFIRM - To confirm the order, if the order is in Draft Order state.
          Please refer to confirmDraftOrder api for information regarding events and user exists.
        • ORDER_CHANGE - To change the SaleVoided flag and AutoCancelDate on the order.
          Please refer to changeOrder api for information regarding events and user exists.
        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        Please refer to the following APIs for information regarding user exists.
        • confirmDraftOrder
        • changeOrder


        Events Raised:
        Please refer to the following APIs for information regarding events.
        • confirmDraftOrder
        • changeOrder


        Audits: Yes.

        Pre-conditions:
        This API assumes order already available in the system. Order can be in either confirmed or Draft Order state.

        Post-conditions: None.

        Output Template Support: No.

        Database Extensibility Support: No.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment() API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated XML input and DTD input files.

        Returns:
        None.


        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes. Click here to see the XML and the associated DTD.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
